summary: An email from Australian lawyer Adrian Praljak to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and a Victim/Witness Coordinator, claiming to be a victim of Jeffrey Epstein's network and Prince Andrew, and offering evidence from submissions made to an Australian Royal Commission. The sender seeks to be added to the U.S. case against Epstein.

persons.name: Adrian Praljak
persons.context: Author of the email, identifies as a victim of sexual and commercial offenses by Jeffrey Epstein's network and Prince Andrew, and is submitting evidence from Australian Royal Commission filings.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Primary recipient of the urgent email, being asked to take action and add the sender to the U.S. case against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the referenced indictment; the sender claims to be a victim of his global network.

persons.name: Prince Andrew, The Duke of York
persons.context: Alleged by the sender to be part of the global network committing offenses, specifically mentioned in relation to the 'Pitch @ Palace' competition and under investigation by the UK Information Privacy Commissioner.

persons.name: The Hon Ronald Sackville AO QC
persons.role: Chair of the Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability
persons.context: Australian official who has received the sender's formal submissions and is reviewing them; the sender has requested a meeting with him.

connections.description: Praljak claims to be a victim of sexual and commercial offenses committed by Jeffrey Epstein and his global network.

connections.person2: Prince Andrew, The Duke of York
connections.description: Praljak claims to be a recent victim of Prince Andrew, specifically regarding commercial information theft via the 'Pitch @ Palace' competition, and has active cases against him.

connections.person2: Prince Andrew, The Duke of York
connections.description: The email references allegations in an indictment about Epstein and his potential global network involving Prince Andrew.
Praljak is urgently contacting Berman, the U.S. Attorney, to provide evidence and request to be added to the U.S. case against Epstein.

events.title: Urgent email submission to U.S. Attorney
events.description: Adrian Praljak sends a highly urgent email to Geoffrey Berman and a Victim/Witness Coordinator, claiming victimhood and offering evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew.

events.title: Filing of submissions to Australian Royal Commission
events.description: Praljak has filed around ten-plus formal submissions with the Australian Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability, which he is forwarding as evidence.
personsInvolved: The Hon Ronald Sackville AO QC

events.title: Investigation into Prince Andrew by UK Commissioner
events.description: The England UK Information Privacy Commissioner is investigating Prince Andrew and The Pitch @ Palace Team regarding alleged theft of commercial information from Praljak.
personsInvolved: Prince Andrew, The Duke of York

locations: Minnesota (referenced in forwarded email about a picture)
keyFacts: An Australian lawyer, Adrian Praljak, claims to be a victim of both sexual and commercial offenses by Jeffrey Epstein's global network and by Prince Andrew.
Praljak alleges Prince Andrew's 'Pitch @ Palace' competition stole his commercial information, leading to active cases and a UK privacy investigation.
The sender has submitted multiple formal filings to an Australian Royal Commission and is offering this evidence for use in the U.S. case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)'.
The email is marked as 'HIGHLY URGENT' and 'PRIVATE & CONFIDENTIAL', indicating the sender's desire for immediate action from U.S. authorities.
The document references a forwarded email about another individual's son being in a picture with Jeffrey Epstein in Minnesota.
